text: Benjamin Chukukadiba Ejefoberi Nwoso was an Anglican priestDOBA in the 20th century.A History of Social Conflict and Conflict Management in Nigeria: A Case Study of Anglican Churches in Ụkwụànìland, Delta State, Nigeria (1900-1941). Nwoso was ordained in 1936 by Morris Gelsthorpe, from 1933 to 1938 Assistant Bishop to the Bishop on the Niger.Ecclesiastical News: two Assistant Bishops for Africa The Times (London, England), Wednesday, Dec 07, 1932; pg. 17; Issue 46310 He was a parish priest from then until 1952 when he was appointed Archdeacon of Owerri. In 1955 he became Archdeacon of Onitsha, a post he held until 1970.Crockford's Clerical Directory 1980-82 p 751 London: Oxford University Press, 1983 ==References== Category:1869 births Category:Archdeacons of Owerri Category:Archdeacons of Onitsha Category:20th- century Anglican priests Category:Year of death missing
title: Benjamin Nwoso
